name: WorldMark Angels Camp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a timeshare months in advance and were PROMISED a great view.....well, 20 feet from our back deck was a gigantic mound of dirt blocking the horizon except for a patch of roof on some otehr building. I overheard the desk people tell some couples who checked in after us that they were getting a wonderful view of the golf course! When I spoke with the front desk, they basically blew me off with the shrugged shoulder look. ANyway, the unit had been remodeled, with typically dull decor. The stove was unlevel, the door to the deck squeaked, and a smoke detector was going off when we opened ther front door. The maintenace guy was there within minutes of our call and replaced batteries. It was great to have a fireplace but the place smelled of propane after we lit it and decided against running it. Again, maintenance was right there to check for leaks.....the maintenance guys should be running that whole place. Great to have a washer/dryer in the unit and the bed was very confortable. At night, the window coverings (blinds) did not darken the room and the light from the parking lot was annoying. There's a couple of pools on property and coffee in the lobby (most of the time). Free access to computers and parking right outside the unit. All in all a good stay, but when I'm promised something, I expect to get it. I keep my word and so should they. Oh, obe nore thing, they charge you what I think they call a "room use tax" which, for our one bedroom was $91.70 for the week. When I asked about this, they blamed it on the state and said that guests are to pay the difference in tax the state loses since you are paying less for the room than if you stayed at a hotel. SO, in other words, the GREAT deal we get because we are timeshare owners is assessed a penalty because we didn't pay retail for a hotel. Oh, yeah, sign me up for more weeks.
reviews.title: Promises, promises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once you enjoy the comfort of a large unit with full kitchen, fireplace and separate bedroom you won't ever want to go back. The resort is off the main highway on the edge of a golf course, so it's quiet. There is a nice pool at the rec center. There are no restaurants on site but you have a choice within a short drive. The second floor units have the master bedroom on an upper level, and there is no vent to it -- only a ceiling fan. Since hot air rises, this means that the master tends to be difficult to cool on a hot day without freezing the quarters downstairs. It's great when you need the furnace, though.
reviews.title: Hotels, eat your heart out!

reviews.text: Four members of the family stayed here recently, as a central place to do several day trips in the area, including San Francisco and Yosemite, both around 2 hours. They are renovating the units, and the unit we stayed in had been recently renovated and felt updated, etc. They could use some lighting over the sink but otherwise the kitchen was well equipped for cooking, and the gas grill on the patio deck came in handy as well. Nearby there's a well stocked and reasonably priced supermarket as well as a drug store. On the way to Yosemite there are several simple but good restaurants (Cross County Cafe, and a restaurant with a great view in Priest, all by itself on top of a hill). Nice pool and hot tub as well as pool table and ping pong available in the club house. Yah, the timeshare sales pitch was a bit annoying but they eventually understand the word "no thanks". Take in a tour of the Ironstone vineyard in Murphy - our tour guide, Calvin, was very knowledgeable and interesting. Not far away, the Calaveras Big Tree state park and Columbia State Park were worth a visit as well.
reviews.title: Relaxing week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a reservation at the Worldmark for two nights while we were on a motorcycle trip through Yosemite and are pretty glad that we did.
reviews.title: Great location, minor issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is nicely laid out by a golf course and the rooms are very nice. Each comes with a fireplace and their own private balcony sectioned off from the rooms surrounding your room. Each room comes with a kitchen fully stocked with all utensils, plates, glasses, pots, etc... for a long stay. The fridge has an ice maker and there is an oven, stove and microwave. You have a separate bedroom and bathroom as well. You even have your own washer and dryer for your clothes with complimentary detergent for one or two loads. You also have a stereo with an ipod deck to hear your own music by the fire! The bed was firm and the bathroom was very clean. A lot of closet space.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our one bedroom room was in the B building which is near the entrance to the resort and the only view we had was of the road, but we were there in August and it was too hot most days to spend much time on the patio anyway. The room had been recently renovated so the carpeting and furnishings were in great shape. We love Worldmark resorts because the rooms are always very nice.
reviews.title: Room with no view, but otherwise very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is in the peaceful and scenic Greenhorn Creek neighbourhood. Other than using the pools on a few days, we didn't spend much time in the resort itself. We just used it as a base for exploring the area. It was close enough to Murphys for wine tastings that it didn't feel out of the way. We also recommend going to the Angels Camp farmers market in Utica Park on Friday evenings.
reviews.title: Perfect place to go for a wonderful vacation in the Sierra Foothills

reviews.text: We would stay here again if we ever came back to the area.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Located in the Sierra foothills, Angels Camp isn't the easiest place to get to, but worth making the effort. The historic town of Murphys is only 8 miles away and has an abundance of wine tasting rooms to enjoy and there are numerous other fun places to visit in the area.
reviews.title: Better than expected!

reviews.text: The Worldmark Resort Condos at Angels Camp offer a traveler the comforts of home and is a wonderful place to visit. It is quiet and peaceful and there is a lot of wildlife all around that is fun to observe. Located right by the Greehhorn Creek Golf Club, it is also convenient to golfing and eating at the club's CAMPS restaurant. The facility has a wonderful pool, hot tub, workout facility and a game room certain to keep teenagers happy. The staff is more than accomodating and they go out of their way to help yoy enjoy your stay. We visited her 5 years ago and waited too long to return. As Arnold would say..."We'll be Back ! " The only negative was the extra surcharge when we checked in. Still don't undrstand what that was all about.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: We invested in the WorldMark Timeshare about 10 years ago mostly to have low cost travel accommodations in the western region. We like having the option of a quasi-residential stay and have been to several properties. I do love nice hotels, too!
reviews.title: Our Go To Timeshare

reviews.text: My family enjoys the Angels Camp Worldmark property quite a bit and we have been going there for a number of years. We never use our timeshare points, rather we go when there is inventory special or bonus time so we pay for housekeeping fees and some nominal tax. We go on long weekends and never as a main vacation destination. It's a real deal from the $$ point of view. It's under 3 hours from our house in Marin County so driving toward warmth and a dry clime is easy. In the winter, there is skiing nearby at Dodge Ridge and Bear Valley that are family friendly, not costly and easy access to the resorts -- the exact opposite of going to Tahoe. We have a 13 year old who can enjoy the two pools, hot tubs and arcade without much supervision. My husband golfs and the course is challenging enough and not expensive. We all love the residential community that makes up Greenhorn Creek and weather permitting (we were just there in the heat wave temps of 112 so stayed inside), we get in our cardio by walking around the entire development while our daughter scooters.
reviews.title: Pleasant one- or two-night location; 'don't think I'd enjoy a week

reviews.text: The units are nice and the recent renovation has improved the place considerably--like a refresh/modernization. Most anyone would feel very comfortable at Angles Camp though the cross section of people is akind to being at Disneyland.
reviews.title: Calaveras Treasure

reviews.text: Perhaps what is most notable for me is the front desk staff -- I have gotten to know several of them over the years which says a lot -- low turn over. They are very nice and try to accommodate my requests. The sales staff are just trying to make a living but I could do without the hard pitch before they give me a parking pass.
reviews.title: Great place as a central point in N. California

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also enjoy the little town of AC and even more so, Murphys. Murphy's is an outpost for Bay Area people so it has some hip restaurants and other retail stores. The winery's are lovely and we especially like Chatam (try Esmeralda wine). A lovely locale if you want to avoid too many people and pretentiousness.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great week going from one old town to an other
reviews.title: Beautiful Week Touring Calif. Gold Country

reviews.text: Home base was Angel Camp,small city not much there but interesting
reviews.title: Now Wyndham Angels Camp

reviews.text: Arnold had a logging jamboree was fun for the men and interesting for the women
reviews.title: Pretty nice stay overall.....
Pleasant get away
reviews.text: Jamestown was the place for old stores and lots of old stuff some antiques(real)
Petes Restaurant was a real find good food and fair prices (open 6 mo.)Jamestown
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

aka: Worldmark Angels Camp Hotel Angels Camp
